Package comp127graphics

Class GraphicsGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • comp127graphics.GraphicsObject
      • comp127graphics.GraphicsGroup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GraphicsObserver
    public class GraphicsGroup
extends GraphicsObject
implements GraphicsObserver
    A group of graphical objects that can be added, moved, and removed as a single unit. The group defines its own coordinate system, so the positions of objects added to it are relative to the whole group's position.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GraphicsGroup()
      Constructs a new group positioned at (0, 0).
      GraphicsGroup​(double x, double y)
      Constructs a new group.

      void draw​(java.awt.Graphics2D gc)
      For internal use.
      boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)

      Returns an axis aligned bounding rectangle for the graphical object in canvas coordinates.

      Returns the topmost graphical object underneath position x, y.

      Get the height of the rectangle that encloses all the elements in the group.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GraphicsGroup

        public GraphicsGroup​(double x,
                     double y)
        Constructs a new group. Each group has its own local coordinate system. The group is positioned on the canvas at canvas position (x, y) when it is added.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -

      • GraphicsGroup

        public GraphicsGroup()
        Constructs a new group positioned at (0, 0). When later used with CanvasWindow's add(GraphicsObject gObject, double x, double y), this group will get placed at x, y.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add​(GraphicsObject gObject)
        Adds given graphical object to the list of objects drawn on the canvas. The last object added is the one that will appear on top.

      • add

        public void add​(GraphicsObject gObject,
                double x,
                double y)
        Adds the graphical object to the list of objects drawn on the canvas at the position x, y.
        Parameters:
        gObject - the graphical object to be drawn
        x - the x position of graphical object
        y - the y position of graphical object

      • remove

        public void remove​(GraphicsObject gObject)
        Removes the object from being drawn
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if gObject is not a part of the graphics group.

      • removeAll

        public void removeAll()
        Removes all of the objects in this group

      • getElementAt

        public GraphicsObject getElementAt​(double x,
                                   double y)
        Returns the topmost graphical object underneath position x, y. If no such object exists, it returns null.
        Parameters:
        x - position in the coordinate space of the container of this group
        y - position in the coordinate space of the container of this group
        Returns:
        object at (x,y) or null if it does not exist.
